page.title: 20AMENITIES.
page.content: The villages of{Netheravon and {Figheldean}are unusual because they have{Working Men's Clubs.}In both villages they form the hub of social life for the whole family as well as more particularly for the men. Events and trips are organised,e.g.to the coast in the summer and Bonfire Night parties. The committees arrange fund raising efforts for other charitable organisations. { A very thriving 'Over 60's' club meets once a month in{Figheldean,}the members enjoy talks, chatting to friends and having tea. Through the organisation members plan and make visits at home and abroad for holidays. { The churches}play an important role in the social life of the villages. {Fetes, harvest suppers,and barn dances bring all together in entertainment.
